name: firebase-jest-testing
description: Tools for testing Firebase back-end features, using Jest.
author: <akauppi@gmail.com>

engines.node: 15.9.0..15.11 (maybe more) and Jest 27.0.0-next.3 have a love bug: https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/37426
engines.npm: >= 7.7.0 because of this (only matters for 'npm publish') -> https://github.com/npm/cli/issues/2834

peerDependencies: Force the downstream project to explicitly depend on these. It would be wrong that we bring the major libs in.

firebase-admin: Seen as an implementation detail - thus in 'dependencies' and not in 'peerDependencies'.
proper-lockfile: Unless Firebase provides read-only access to the Firestore emulator, or there is a better locking approach,
we are stuck with needing an OS level locking library. This one seemed simple, and does not need native compiles.
Intentionally sticking with '4.1.1'. Its implementation is simple.
